content.synopsis: Cultural Revolution. Red Coast Base. A message sent to the stars. Humanity's first contact with an alien civilization turns into a countdown to doomsday.

characters.title: Dramatis Personae

list.name: Ye Wenjie
list.desc: Astrophysicist. Witnessed the madness of humanity and decided to invite an external power to purify the Earth.
list.quote: I lit the fire, but I cannot control how it burns.

list.name: Wang Miao
list.desc: Nanomaterials researcher. Dragged into the game by the military. The eyes through which we see the universe collapse.
list.quote: The entire universe has flickered for you.

list.name: Shi Qiang
list.desc: A rude, chain-smoking detective. He doesn't understand physics, but he understands survival.
list.quote: Even if God is dead, the bugs are still multiplying.

list.name: Mike Evans
list.desc: Heir to an oil empire. Radical environmentalist. Founded the ETO to welcome the Lord.

characters.relations: Ye Wenjie (Spiritual Leader) <-> Mike Evans (Financial Backer) | Wang Miao (Pawn) <-> Shi Qiang (Protector)

one.title: I. The Madness Years
one.subtitle: 1969, Greater Khingan Mountains
one.text:
The madness years of the Cultural Revolution. Ye Wenjie witnesses her father's death and loses faith in humanity.

She discovered that the sun could act as a super-antenna, amplifying radio waves by a billion times. She sent a message into the deep cosmos, a message of invitation, born from a total loss of faith in humanity.
one.quote: To conquer a civilization, you must effectively destroy its science.

two.title: II. The Three-Body Game
two.subtitle: The Virtual Reality
two.text:
Wang Miao put on the V-suit and entered the game. He saw a world of constant destruction. The suns did not rise and set; they danced. Sometimes three suns would appear at once, burning everything to ash.

This was not a game. It was a simulation of a real world—Alpha Centauri. A world doomed by the chaotic gravitational interaction of three suns.

three.title: III. Judgment Day
three.subtitle: The Panama Canal
three.text:
The ship 'Judgment Day' approached the canal. It carried the traitor of humanity and the secrets of the Trisolarans.

Captain Shi Qiang lit a cigarette. 'Nano-material,' he grinned. The 'Flying Blade' trap was set. As the massive ship passed through the invisible nanowires, it was sliced like a loaf of bread. Layer by layer, the steel groaned and slid apart. It was a silent, brutal symphony of physics.

conclusion.title: The End of Innocence
conclusion.text:
The Three-Body Problem is not just about aliens. It is a mirror of our own history. It asks: Is humanity worth saving? And if the universe is a dark forest, should we light a fire?

The fleet is coming. But as Shi Qiang pointed out in the locust fields: 'Look at the bugs. Humans have tried to exterminate them for thousands of years. But they are still here.'
conclusion.final_word: WE ARE BUGS. BUT WE HAVE NEVER BEEN DEFEATED.

metadata.title: The Dark Forest
metadata.subtitle: The Wallfacers
metadata.description: Survival is the primary need of civilization.

content.synopsis: Trisolaris has locked Earth's science with sophons. The Doomsday Battle is 400 years away. Humanity's only hope lies in the Wallfacer Project—strategies hidden in the human mind, the only place sophons cannot read.
content.intro: The universe is a dark forest. Every civilization is an armed hunter.

characters.title: Dramatis Personae

list.name: Luo Ji
list.desc: A cynical sociologist. He holds the switch to two worlds in his hand, becoming the only human Trisolaris fears.

list.name: Zhang Beihai
list.desc: A far-sighted soldier. He knows humanity will lose. For the only spark of civilization to survive, he hijacks a warship into the deep void.

list.name: Shi Qiang
list.desc: Luo Ji's guardian angel. In the darkest forest, he is the most reliable lighthouse protecting the final hope.

list.name: Ding Yi
list.desc: The man who faced the Droplet. He tapped on the absolute smooth surface and was the first to see the cruel truth of the universe.

characters.relations: Luo Ji (Swordholder) <-> Shi Qiang (Guardian) | Zhang Beihai (Escapist) <-> Ding Yi (Seeker)

one.title: I. The Wallfacers
one.subtitle: The UN Planetary Defense Council
one.text:
Four men were chosen. They were given unlimited resources and no requirement to explain their actions. Their true strategic intent must remain concealed in their minds. Three of them were statesmen and scientists. The fourth, Luo Ji, was a nobody—a cynical sociologist who just wanted to live a good life.

But the Trisolarans fear him. Because he knows the cosmic axiom: 'chains of suspicion' and 'technological explosion'.
one.quote: The universe is a dark forest. Every civilization is an armed hunter stalking through the trees.

two.title: II. The Droplet
two.subtitle: The Doomsday Battle
two.text:
Two centuries later. Humanity has built a magnificent stellar fleet: 2,000 warships, lined up in a rectangular formation to display dignity. The Trisolaran probe arrived. It was small, smooth, shaped like a teardrop. It looked fragile, like a mirror reflecting the galaxy.

Then it moved. It accelerated to twice the speed of light instantly, ignoring inertia. It punched through the fusion fuel tanks of the first ship. Then the second. In 30 minutes, the pride of humanity was reduced to fireworks. It wasn't a war. It was a disrespectful swatting of a bug.

three.title: III. The Spell
three.subtitle: The Grave of a Star
three.text:
Luo Ji stood in the snow. He had failed as a Wallfacer. He was dying. But he had one last card.

He broadcasted the coordinates of a distant star system to the universe. Then he waited. Fifty years later, the star was destroyed by a 'photoid' from an unknown civilization. The Dark Forest theory was proven. He held a gun to his own heart—which was broadcast to the sun—threatening to expose Trisolaris to the hunters.
three.quote: I am speaking to Trisolaris. Let there be light.

conclusion.title: Deterrence Established
conclusion.text: Luo Ji sat by the grave of the ant, holding the button that could destroy two worlds. The Trisolarans backed down. The Dark Forest Deterrence Era began. A fragile peace, built on the threat of mutual assured destruction.

metadata.title: Death's End
metadata.subtitle: Before the Collapse
metadata.description: Death is the only lighthouse that is always lit.

content.synopsis: The deterrence era ends. Gravity broadcast is sent. The solar system is exposed to the dark forest. Now, humanity faces the ultimate weapon of cosmic cleansing: The Dual-Vector Foil.
content.intro: Weakness and ignorance are not barriers to survival, but arrogance is.

characters.title: Dramatis Personae

list.name: Cheng Xin
list.desc: The embodiment of love. Because of her love and mercy, humanity lost two chances for survival. But is love wrong?

list.name: Yun Tianming
list.desc: The lonely brain. He told three fairy tales among the stars, pointing out the only way of life for humanity in despair.
list.quote: He came, he loved, he gave her a star, he left.

list.name: Thomas Wade
list.desc: Ruthless for survival. Lose humanity, lose much; lose beastliness, lose everything.
list.quote: Advance! Advance!! Advance at any cost!!!

list.name: Sophon
list.desc: Trisolaris's representative on Earth. A beautiful woman in a tea ceremony, gracefully wielding a katana, with destruction behind her.

characters.relations: Cheng Xin (Love) <-> Wade (Beastliness) | Yun Tianming (Guardian) <-> Sophon (Destruction)

one.title: I. The Staircase Project
one.subtitle: A Brain in Space
one.text:
Before the Doomsday Battle, we sent a probe. We couldn't send a human, so we sent a brain. Yun Tianming, a dying man, bought a star for Cheng Xin, the woman he secretly loved. Then he allowed his brain to be harvested and launched into the abyss, hoping to infiltrate the Trisolaran fleet.

He floated in the cold dark for centuries, dreaming of fairy tales.

two.title: II. The Swordholder
two.subtitle: 15 Minutes of Hell
two.text:
Luo Ji held the switch for 54 years. He became a statue, gazing at a white wall, maintaining the deterrence. Then he handed the sword to Cheng Xin.

The Trisolarans calculated her 'deterrence degree': 10%. They attacked immediately. In 15 minutes, gravitational antennas were destroyed. The deterrence ended. Humanity was herded into Australia to be eaten.

three.title: III. The Dual Vector Foil
three.subtitle: The Starry Night
three.text:
The solar system was not destroyed by raw power. It was cleaned. A slip of paper, shining with a soft light, was thrown into the system. It was a 'Dual Vector Foil'—a piece of two-dimensional space.

Space itself began to collapse. 3D objects fell into 2D. The sun, the planets, the people—unfolded into an infinite painting. It was beautiful. It was death. The entire solar system became a masterpiece of static art.

conclusion.title: Zero Dimension
conclusion.text: Cheng Xin escaped to a mini-universe. But to reboot the dying universe, all mass must be returned. She left behind a small aquarium with a fish, and stepped into the uncertain future. The universe might die, or it might be reborn.
